title: Experts say Mexico military holding info on missing students
description: A group of international experts investigating the 2014 disappearance of 43 students in southern Mexico says Mexico’s military has failed to hand over key information on the case

title: Mexican military accused of hindering probe of 43 missing students
description: International investigators claim the country's powerful military is blocking access to details that could be crucial in solving the students' disappearance.

title: Andrew Tate and brother released from jail, put under house arrest
description: Andrew Tate, who spent months in a Romanian jail accused of human trafficking, won an appeal to go on house arrest.

title: Arresting U.S. journalist, Kremlin ruthlessly pursues wartime aims
description: The arrest of Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and prosecution of a Russian dad spotlight Vladimir Putin's willingness to disregard global norms and squash dissent at all costs.

title: Romania: Andrew Tate's detention replaced with house arrest
description: An official says Andrew Tate, the divisive internet personality who has spent months in a Romanian jail on suspicion of organized crime and human trafficking, has won an appeal to replace his detention with house arrest

title: Climate protesters who stormed British Grand Prix avoid jail
description: Six climate change activists were spared prison sentences for storming last year’s British Grand Prix Formula 1 race in one of a series of disruptive protests against fossil fuels

title: Mexico president assigns blame elsewhere for migrant tragedy
description: Mexico’s president visiting hospitals treating injured migrants in the border city of Ciudad Juarez, where 39 men died in a immigration detention center fire

title: Moscow hadn’t accused a U.S. reporter of spying since the Cold War — until this week
description: The USSR said U.S. journalist Robert Daniloff was a spy in 1986. Nearly four decades later, Moscow said the same of WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich.

title: Several injured as 2 Swiss regional trains derail in storm
description: Police say two regional trains in Switzerland have derailed in separate incidents, injuring more than a dozen people after a storm brought high winds and strong rains to the small Alpine nation

title: Lourdes shrine reviewing mosaics after Jesuit abuse claims
description: Officials at the Catholic shrine in Lourdes are mulling what to do with the French sanctuary’s mosaics

title: Italy temporarily bans ChatGPT over privacy concerns
description: The Italian data protection agency cited concerns about privacy and the absence of age checks with the artificial-intelligence chatbot.

title: Child missing after migrant bodies found near Canada border
description: Authorities in the Mohawk Territory of Akwesasne say one child is missing after the bodies of six migrants of Indian and Romanian descent were pulled from the river Thursday

title: Officials say arson behind most wildfires in northern Spain
description: Officials in the small northern Spanish region of Asturias say arsonists are behind most of some 100 wildfires raging in the heavily wooded and mountainous area

title: 2 foreign nationals die in small plane crash in Croatia
description: Croatian authorities say that a small plane has crashed in a northern town, killing two people on board

title: Stampede at food distribution center kills 11 in Pakistan
description: Pakistani police say at least eight people have been killed in a deadly stampede at a Ramadan food distribution center in the southern port city of Karachi

title: Prosecutors in Senegal appeal opposition leader's sentence
description: Prosecutors in Senegal are appealing the two-month suspended sentence handed down to the West African country’s top opposition leader

title: Estonian diplomat expelled from Moscow in tit for tat move
description: Estonia says Russia is expelling an Estonian diplomat from Moscow in a tit for tat move following a similar action by Tallinn

title: Berlin museum presents 100 works by artist Gerhard Richter
description: A new show of works by one of Germany’s most famous living artists, Gerhard Richter, has opened at Berlin’s Neue Nationalgalerie museum

title: Israeli strikes near Syrian capital kill Iranian adviser
description: Syrian state media says Israel has launched airstrikes on the suburbs of Syria’s capital for the second day in a row

title: Greece: Suspects in foiled Passover attack appear in court
description: Two men accused of planning a Passover attack on a Jewish center in central Athens are appearing in court to answer to terrorism charges

title: After being fired, Israel's defense minister caught in limbo
description: Five days ago, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s decision to fire his defense minister set off a wave of spontaneous protests and a general strike that threatened to paralyze the country, forcing the Israeli leader to suspend his divisive plan to overhaul the judicial system

title: EU official says major aid to Lebanon depends on IMF deal
description: A European Union official visiting Lebanon says the international body will boost its humanitarian assistance to the crisis-stricken country, but that more significant long-term aid depends on reforms and a deal with the International Monetary Fund

title: Vatican announces the pope will be leaving the hospital Saturday
description: After being hospitalized for bronchitis Wednesday there were fears for the 86-year-old pontiff's health.

title: Norway makes country's largest-ever cocaine seizure in Oslo
description: Police in Norway say officers made the largest-ever cocaine seizure in the country when they discovered 800 kilograms (1,760 pounds) of the drug in boxes of fruit in Oslo

title: How China let a ship banned for ferrying North Korean coal go rogue
description: The case of the Petrel 8, a zombie ship that came back to life, shows that the sanction regime on Pyongyang is full of holes.

title: 10 years after murdering his girlfriend, Oscar Pistorius is up for parole
description: South African Paralympic sprinter Oscar Pistorius was found guilty of shooting model Reeva Steenkamp dead on Valentines Day 2013. He became eligible for parole in July.

title: Death scene in burned Filipino ferry moves rescuers to tears
description: A Philippine coast guard commander says the tragic scenes of death his team saw aboard a gutted ferry, including adults clutching children, moved them to tears and sparked fears other passengers could be found dead in the still-smoldering ship

title: Vatican: Pope spends 2nd night 'serenely' in hospital
description: The Vatican says Pope Francis has spent his second night in a Rome hospital serenely as he receives antibiotics intravenously to treat bronchitis

title: Vatican rejects ‘doctrine of discovery’ used to justify colonial rule
description: The Catholic Church's move comes centuries after papal decrees were used by European powers to seize Indigenous land in Canada, the United States and elsewhere.

title: The stuffed animals comforting Ukraine’s children in wartime
description: “It’s like a line appeared," said a fourth-grade teacher in Bucha. "There was childhood on one side — and all of a sudden they grew up.”

title: Sudan state media says 10 workers dead in gold mine collapse
description: Sudanese authorities say at least 10 people are dead after a gold mine collapsed in northern Sudan

title: Ukraine live briefing: Turkey approves Finland’s NATO bid; U.S. in direct contact with Russia over detained journalist
description: Russia has detained 31-year-old Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich for alleged espionage, charges the White House called “ridiculous.”

title: Members of exiled Chinese church detained in Thailand
description: Supporters of a Chinese Christian church say more than 60 members have been detained in Thailand, raising fears they may be returned to their home country where they face possible persecution

title: Taiwan leader scrambles for allies in Central America visit
description: As Taiwan’s diplomatic partners dwindle and turn instead to rival China, Taiwanese President President Tsai Ing-wen is aiming to shore up ties with the self-governing island’s remaining allies during a trip this week to Central America

title: Under Biden, U.S. sees unions as key ally in democracy agenda
description: The importance of organized labor in the life of democracies and how to bolster unions were main themes on the last day of the Summit for Democracy.
